Dating: AMENHOTEP III/AMENOPHIS III/NEBMAATRE (not after); 18TH DYNASTY; TUTHMOSIS IV/MENKHEPERURE (not before)
Name: Group statue of Tuthmosis and Ia
Description: This group statue depicts the official Tuthmosis together with his wife or mother Ia seated on a plain seat with a high back with their feet resting on a footstool. The man is wearing a short-sleeved garment over an ankle-length kilt. His head is missing but his wig must have been a short type. The woman is dressed in a long dress and a plain long wig. The outer arms of both figures are placed on their thighs, but their other arms are around each other. The carving is summary which indicates that the details were originally rendered in paint.
